reviews.review_msg: Entertaining, charismatic and funny! Paul Li has it all, I think his class was one of the best Chem classes at SFU!
honestly this class wasn't hard. anyone who says otherwise is coping and needs to get their life in check. If you study you will pass. If you fail, its your fault.

Paul Li is one of the worst professors at SFU. He barely teaches in class, has truly awful slides, and gives the hardest tests I've ever seen at SFU. The midterm average was 48% with the final average being 37% (in a class of 22). The tutorial is an extension of class with him where he will not answer questions. Please avoid him AT ALL COSTS.

Course content is explained well, backed up by examples and in class problem though his voice can be soft at times. He is very open to questions and answers emails in a short amount of time. Exams are quite fair as he tells you exactly what's on it. Textbook is minimally used. As long as you do Lon capa and read though the examples you'll be fine.
Very Nice Prof, patient and will try his best to explain concepts and answer questions. Shows interest in what he teaches.

Wonderful prof, super helpful, reliable, and makes lectures enjoyable and understandable. Exams are a breeze if you put in the work. Students need to understand that a prof cant feed you the answers you need to put in the work outside of the classroom to do well in any class.
just avoid him
no comment
Below average experience. He is a nice human but doesn't have the best teaching ability.

Seems like a pretty nice guy but probably the worst prof I've had so far at SFU. Spent most of the time showing us how to do the loncapa q's in class instead of teaching.  Midterms were a joke but the final consisted of most of the long loncapa q's as MC questions. Do not really feel all that prepared for my future analytical courses

Analytical is my favourite chemistry, and Paul Li is the worst prof I have ever had. He doesn't teach, wastes class time because he doesn't know how to do problems and spends vast amounts of time discussing unrelated topics. Unfair midterms and final, impossibly long for the given time period. AVOID AT ALL COSTS.
Compare to all analytical professors. He actually TEACHES the best. He REALLY helps you in office hour. However, exams are long but straight forward. I hope he could teach me chem316 but...

Expects you to know pretty obscure things on exams.  Doesn't really seem to care about teaching and has a rather condescending attitude towards students.  I'd avoid him.  The lab is really ghetto too.
No Comments

I gave him good ratings until we got the final... It wasn't really anything that we did in the book at all from the first part of the course.. pretty much the final screwed everyone over. study his notes carefully and if you don't understand them, make sure get help from him (dont assume it wont be on a test)

He notes are terrible, he's always totally unprepared. He seems to concentrate too much on his "research" and slacks off in lectures. Most of the studying comes from the textbook, not his notes. His exams are totally unpredictable.

Aye, his notes are atrocious and this is compounded by his teaching method of touching upon concepts and sections from multiple chapters. However, one can understand what he says and he seems to be a good guy.

This class although interesting involved too much work and I found myself actually struggling with the loncapa due in part that she does not teach anything valuable to us or she completely skips over it. The only positive thing is that shes actually really nice and I do have to give her an A+ on that, but teaching wise, a D for sure

WORST PROF EVER.. i read through the ratings prior to taking this class and i thought to myself i will just try harder... i did and it was still the worst possible class i ever took, its suposed to be an easy course turned out to be harder then organic chem.. i saw someone crying after the final exam.. NEVER EVER TAKE A COURSE WITH GOYAN EVERR..

Why is she still allowed to teach? SFU must have pretty low standards. Bad notes, no lecturing (about the course!), impossible exams (because we're not taught anything). I gave her the benefit of the doubt event though I checked here first, but everyone is right..she sucks. Avoid like the plague!! And she really needs to lose the pajamas.

serious speaking, i learn nothing in this course, even i attend most of the classes. her notes aren'e clear. since the class average is kinda sad, it scaled alot. so yea go ahead take it, its not that bad actually.
Her office is always open to all the students. She is really passionate in teaching.
Great prof. I learned so much from her.

absolutely THE worst prof i have ever had. wasted power points on stupid comics where she could have added more explanations. notes are useless, expects you to memorize text- which is the crappiest book ever. exams were way too long and hard. i finished this class with the same amount of knowledge as i entered. DO NOT TAKE CHEM 215 WITH HER!

Yes, she used someone else's notes which lead to confusion in the lectures at some points. The midterm was killer  she didn't do enough problems in class which lead many to not realize the hardness of the course, the loncapa was hard but this is take home, its expected to be way harder. The final was long and hard, but expected difficulty. Shes Ok.

She not only uses someone else's notes but doesn't even review them before coming to lecture. She reeds off a power point without explaining. Review sessions were pointless because she didn't even know how to solve some of the questions.  Exams were too long and the textbook was so useless I had to refer to my 1st year text for help

Should not be professor at a post-secondary instition. It makes me mad to think that I paid for this class. I learned nothing from her lecture! She wastes my time by telling stories about her stupid dogs, her clarinet quartet, and more. I don't care. I wanted to learn the course material, Dr. Goyan was no help.

Writes very long, difficult, unreasonable exams but has NO right to do so considering her lectures cover a minimal amount of material very poorly. Holds an office hour, but instead of explaining concepts, she prefers to humiliate you by bombarding you with questions you can't answer because of her startlingly sub-par teaching ability in lecture.

Hands down, the worst professor I have ever had. Reads through lecture slides FAR too fast...we finished the course a month BEFORE THE FIRST MIDTERM! And the first (and only) midterm was set to only a month before the final. If you have to take this course avoid taking it with Goyan at all costs, even if it means you have to take it in the summer.
Professor does not teach but reads off a powerpoint slide show. She just zips through 20 slides in 1 lecture. Does not explain calculations at all. This is mostly a self-taught class.
Great prof. Very approachable for help. For exams, study the examples in notes then read the book. His midterms are 5 questions and worth 100 marks. his final 2x length of mt and worth 350 marks

She is very disorganized, goes through lecture VERY fast, sometimes its difficult to read because she uses the chalkboard. The best way to do well and pass this course is to do the textbook questions AND exercises in her notes. She actually used the same exam as the practice exam she gave us which was VERY surprising.

IDK what to even say. Can be a good teacher but isn't. Disorganized, unclear, and just not worth it in my opinion. You CAN still get a good grade in this class, but you won't have an easy time and you'll be teaching yourself.

Yeah forget about going to lecture because you won't learn a thing. This class was harder than any class I've ever taken; everybody did poorly and it was curved by at least 15%. I failed the lecture but still got a C+ lol
I guess they let anyone get PhDs and become proffs now

Starts off fine, likes everyone, Iclicker quizzes were 5% and she would use it as a way to check where students are at a particular concept. gets annoyed when she sees the I clicker results show 80% of the people picking the wrong answer. She intends to help by using the white board, people sitting in the back cant see, "incoherent in everything"
